description: Rada Miskovic collects and cross-checks reports of families and groups losing all BCI records, suspecting targeted erasure due to score anomalies.
Rada decides to break her investigation, releasing an exposé on the disappearance and erasure of citizens from the BCI system, emphasizing personal loss and systemic cruelty.
The city erupts in outrage as personal stories of the 'Vanished' circulate, prompting protests and spontaneous aid efforts. Makeshift camps form as more erased residents join together.
Journalists and activists uncover prototype BCI code from the early Halden era as the cause of the erasures, intensifying public anger toward both the Council and the system itself.
Facing mass unrest, the Council promises a system audit and possible restoration of vanished citizens, but trust in BCI governance collapses, sparking demands for real reform.
